info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 16 at 2:00PM CDT until July 16 at 2:15PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR LITTLE RIVER...MILLER...SOUTHERN SEVIER...MARION...EASTERN CASS...CENTRAL HARRISON AND SOUTHEASTERN BOWIE COUNTIES... At 200 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nashville to near Fouke to 7 miles northwest of Waskom, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Texarkana, Marshall, Atlanta, Wake Village, Ashdown, New Boston, Horatio, Foreman, Hallsville, Nash, Hooks, Waskom, Jefferson, Linden, Queen City, Redwater, Maud, Red Lick, Fouke and Wilton. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
